title: Arqustik App
subtitle: Tool for calculating manufacturing costs.
description: This tool is designed to facilitate the quoting process for PVC windows manufactured by Arqustik SAS, Colombia, enabling a faster commercial approach. It has a public section for interested users to obtain quotes, and a private section for managing the customer's web interactions.
role: Design, development, and management of the application
contribution: In this project, we collaborated closely with the sales and management department to create a customized tool that meets the client's specific needs. This was accomplished through attentive and effective listening.

workData.problem: Retail customers were constantly complaining about the response time in the traditional way of finding out the price of a product. This was due to how complex and personalized a project can be, which led to thinking of another communication channel with a faster response and better management of these clients.
workData.solution: To address the issue, I developed a retail web application using technologies like Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Strapi, and PostgreSQL. The website enabled customers to quickly and easily obtain product specification and pricing information, significantly improving the customer experience. In addition, I implemented an estimate costing function for the work. I used Next.js to develop the hybrid application both on the server side, which allowed for better search engine optimization, and on the client, which allowed for a better user interface experience.
workData.outcome: As a result, the retailer was able to significantly improve customer satisfaction and reduce response times for information on prices and product specifications. The advanced search function and the construction cost calculation system also made the customer's shopping experience more efficient. Overall, my ability to apply modern web technologies such as Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Strapi, and PostgreSQL enabled me to develop an effective and efficient solution that improved customer experience and increased customer satisfaction for retail.

title: E-commerce Sehos
subtitle: App to manage an E-commerce.
description: This is a group project that I carried out along with 7 other team members, whose main objective was to complete the #SoyHenry boot-camp. We used the Scrum methodology for development, and my role focused on teamwork, unifying criteria, creating functionalities in the frontend, implementing some functionalities in the user panel such as purchase listing, delivery address management and profile details, among other activities. The project arose from the need to provide a solution to companies affected by the in-person restrictions during the pandemic, specifically in the consumption of fashion products, allowing companies to enter the virtual market and promoting free trade and healthy competition among merchants.
contribution: As a contributor to the project, my role included designing and developing the frontend while also collaborating on the backend. My most important contributions included the functionality of the user screen, billing and purchases, configuration of the client model, the implementation of the functionality and view of the user panel, and the front-end/back-end implementation of the system of reviews.
role: Designed and developed the frontend while also collaborating on the backend.

title: Rick and Morty App
subtitle: Personal Project frontend
description: Design and development of a single page application (SPA) based on the TV series Rick and Morty, as a requirement to participate in the Gentlemen's Programming Hackathon.
contribution: Project created with the purpose of practicing my skills in frontend development

title: Pokemon app
subtitle: Full-stack app based on Pokemon.
description: Individual Project (PI) required for Henry's Bootcamp approval. Here the knowledge acquired during the course of the bootcamp is put to the test regarding the creation of a relational database, the creation of a Backend that connects this database and the corresponding connection with the Frontend to reach a fully functional SPA.

title: Development Services Portfolio

title: Add In Tech App
subtitle: CRUD - App full stack
description: I designed and developed a simple full-stack SPA as a technical test, which required a CRUD functionality. The application includes a product listing as a catalog and an admin panel with CRUD functions to manage the products.
